intro: Aizoon portulacaceum, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Due to its drought tolerance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
